verb.description: Bring to completion or reality; achieve or realize (something desired, promised, or predicted)
examples: he wouldn't be able to fulfill his ambition to visit Naples

verb.description: Carry out (a task, duty, or role) as required, pledged, or expected.
examples: some officials were dismissed because they could not fulfill their duties

origin: Late Old English fullfyllan fill up, make full (see full, fill).
